identity.description: Paper-based metadata example derived from Ménoret et al. (Scientific Reports, 2018). The paper reports a transportable Absolute Quantum Gravimeter (AQG) using Rubidium atoms and two-photon stimulated Raman transitions, designed for operation under real-world conditions. This instance captures only values explicitly stated in the public article text.

atomicSource.isotopeDetail: Rubidium atoms (matter-wave interferometry with two-photon stimulated Raman transitions)
atomicSource.notes: The paper emphasizes operability by non-specialists, compactness/transportability, and continuous absolute g measurement.

pulseSequence.notes: Measurement sequence based on matter-wave interferometry with Rubidium atoms using two-photon stimulated Raman transitions.

mass.note: Sensor head mass reported in the paper.

height.note: Measurement height reported for the sensor head setup.

dimensions.notes: Paper reports setup time < 20 min and warm-up time ~ 1 h.

sensitivity.note: Reported sensitivity at 2 Hz repetition rate.

bandwidth.note: Repetition rate reported; effective measurement cadence.

performance.notes: Paper reports long-term stability below 10 nm/s^2 (1 uGal) and continuous measurements during a month-long campaign.

reference.title: Gravity measurements below 10−9 g with a transportable absolute quantum gravimeter
arXiv preprint: Gravity measurements below 10−9 g with a transportable absolute quantum gravimeter

provenance.citation: Ménoret, V. et al. (2018). Gravity measurements below 10−9 g with a transportable absolute quantum gravimeter. Scientific Reports 8, 12300.
